Name: AMEOS Hospital Alfeld
Kommentare:
(Translated by Google) I was from 21.03 - 04.04. 2019 in pain therapy at the AMEOS Hospital in Alfeld in treatment. The recording worked very well ECG was made, blood pressure was measured and blood was taken before it went on ward. On the ward 4 provided for the pain therapy, I was very kindly received by the sister Nikolina and brought to my room. I was presented the plans for the meal and explained, because I came on the day of admission a little later than all the others (I had an appointment before, but was discussed). There were interviews on the first day, and you had time to stash your things. In the room itself (I had a single room) was a bathroom, a closet with lockable safe, a fridge and a small closet, plenty of space to store the things. Television, telephone and Internet in one device, requires a registration below, I have paid 20 ‚Ç¨ for 20 days (the price is ok). The doctor Karcheva-Kazakova personally was very nice to me from day one. She responded very well to questions on my part and also explained very well. So it went on. Also the physiotherapy team, especially Steffi, responded very well to questions from us. She taught us very well in equipment training and in the exercise pool. I twice had a single physiotherapy session with massage (I would have liked more of that). The discussions with the psychotherapist Mr. Martin were very good. The PDA and procaine infusions were very good for me personally. Also, the food was OK, a hospital adequate (you can not expect a four star hotel) All in all, I highly recommend the AMEOS Hospital in Alfeld in terms of pain therapy. It's a good, clean hospital, friendly staff, doctors who can listen. Pain therapy helped me to 70%.

Klinikum Alfeld Pain Management PRO:
friendly staff
listening doctors
good food (choice of 3 lunch, always hot food, the hospital adequate)
Great physiotherapy
good supply and control, even from the night shift

no patient W-LAN (now have other hospitals, not everyone has a laptop)

I have not found any more to complain about, this recession does not refer to pain therapy to anything else. I will continue to consider the hospital as I felt very comfortable throughout the area. My thanks go to the entire team, the pain therapy of the AMEOS-Hospital in Alfeld, as well as the team of physiotherapy.

Name: AMEOS Hospital Alfeld
Kommentare:
(Translated by Google) First of all, a compliment goes to the nursing and reception staff who do their best for the patients, but as the patients seem to have become victims of a profit-oriented company and the political course set for this.
Efforted and genuinely honest employees are expressly excluded from the following criticism personally:

As soon as you enter the house, you regularly walk through unpleasant clouds of smoke from people who smoke and have a very uncomfortable feeling about the health assignment.
The smoke is also drawing into the building. On the no-smoking sign (!) In the expressly designated smoke-free entrance area, there are regularly up to 30 cigarette butts, some of which are still smoking.
Calls to the complaints hotline show that this is a dead end and obviously only acts as an alibi function, there does not seem to be any remedy intended, unfortunately the described conditions have existed for years. An avoidable very bad first business card for the house and the slogan "We work for your health" already a farce here. The truth is written on every pack of cigarettes, but health protection is trampled on by those responsible who could turn this situation off when entering the clinic and not counteracted. What a mockery.

You quickly lose confidence in some treating physicians (currently internal department / geriatrics). Documents / consultations do not reach doctors who are further treating, that seems to be irrelevant to all those involved when asked. Shrug your shoulders, that's it (unfortunately).

The prompt mobilization of the patient after surgery, which was possible a few months ago in Alfeld and is definitely worthy of praise, seems to have de facto been abolished, anyone who asks about this feels as if he wants to book a flight with the spaceship to Mars.
Other hospitals are much better positioned here and are actually implementing contemporary findings on early mobilization for the benefit of the patient. "We work for your health" is only half the story here. In fact, work has to be carried out according to capitalist and contingent specifications and the patient unfortunately often falls by the wayside. The best thing to do is to arrive 10 minutes before operations and disappear again very quickly, the next flat rate case is already waiting, that is a new motto, somewhat exaggerated.

A senior physician's letter that I have received is so cozy, sometimes wrong and incomplete that it makes one fear and anxiety. Even the family doctor had to ask the patient to clear up inconsistencies. Many other patients and visitors have the impression with me that the human health system is on the verge of collapse and nobody dares to speak out openly.

In my experience, people as individuals are only perceived by very few doctors; for most of them, they are just a cost figure in billing lists. Anyone who recognizes and pronounces this quickly rises to the fine picture, although the naming of this problem is a necessary approach to problem solving.
Holistic Human Caring Healing Treatment - I'm old enough to remember that there was such a thing once. At the moment, all humanity is being abolished and only suggested by skillfully put on acting.

No change is to be expected from the servants, they are caught in "What bread I eat, what song I sing".
Our health system has been a valuable achievement that has been hard-earned by the older generations.
Every voter should be aware that decision-makers of so-called established parties are politically destroying this achievement. In addition to the silence of the press (it is in the hands of a few heavier people who may also be invested in the profit-oriented sponsorships of the clinic corporations), it is here to look for the pullers.

There is even worse to fear when the crowd is silent.
In the event of illness, you may be the next affected.

(Original)

Bem√ºhte und aufrichtig ehrliche Bedienstete sind von nachfolgender Kritik ausdr√ºcklich pers√∂nlich ausgenommen:

Schon beim Betreten des Hauses gehen Sie regelm√§√üig durch unangenehme Dunstwolken rauchender Personen und haben ein sehr mulmiges Gef√ºhl was den Gesundheitsauftrag anbelangt.
Der Rauch zieht auch in das Geb√§ude. Auf dem Rauchverbotsschild (!) im ausdr√ºcklich ausgewiesenen rauchfreien Eingangsbereich liegen regelm√§√üig bis zu 30 Zigarettenkippen die teilweise noch qualmen.
Anrufe bei der Beschwerdehotline lassen erkennen, dass dies eine Sackgasse  ist und offensichtlich nur als Alibifunktion fungiert, es scheint keinerlei Abhilfe beabsichtigt zu sein, die beschriebenen Zust√§nde bestehen leider bereits seit Jahren. Eine vermeidbar sehr schlechte erste Visitenkarte f√ºr das Haus und der Slogan "Wir arbeiten f√ºr Ihre Gesundheit" schon hier eine Farce. Auf jeder Zigarettenpackung steht die Wahrheit aber der Schutz der Gesundheit wird von den Verantwortlichen die diese Zust√§nde abstellen k√∂nnten schon beim Betreten der Klinik mit F√º√üen getreten und nicht gegengesteuert. Welch ein Hohn.

In einige behandelnden √Ñrzte verliert man sehr schnell das Vertrauen (aktuell innere Abteilung/Geriatrie). Unterlagen/Konsile erreichen weiterbehandelnde √Ñrzte nicht, das scheint allen Beteiligten auf R√ºckfrage egal zu sein. Schulterzucken, das wars (leider).

Die noch vor einigen Monaten in Alfeld m√∂gliche und durchaus lobenswerte zeitnahe Mobilisierung des Patienten nach Eingriffen scheint de facto abgeschafft zu sein, wer hiernach fragt kommt sich vor, als w√ºrde er  einem Flug mit dem Raumschiff zum Mars buchen wollen.

Ein mir vorliegender Chefarztbrief ist so luschig, teilweise falsch und unvollst√§ndig gehalten, dass einem Angst und Bange wird. Viele andere Patienten und Besucher haben mit mir den Eindruck, dass das menschliche Gesundheitssystem vor dem Kollaps steht und niemand wagt das offen auszusprechen.

Der Mensch als Individuum wird nach meinen Erfahrungen nur noch von den wenigsten √Ñrzten wahrgenommen, er ist f√ºr die meisten lediglich eine Kostenziffer in Abrechnungslisten. Unser Gesundheitssystem war eine wertvolle Errungenschaft die von den √§lteren Generatonen hart erarbeitet wurde.
